 På Hach (Hach Careers) säkerställer vi vattenkvaliteten för människor runt om i världen, och varje medarbetare spelar en viktig roll i det uppdraget. Vår grundläggande vision är att göra vattenanalyser bättre - snabbare, enklare, grönare och mer informativa. Vi uppnår detta genom lagarbete, kundpartnerskap, passionerade experter och pålitliga, lättanvända lösningar.
   

  

 Som en del av vårt team kommer du att göra en omedelbar, mätbar inverkan på en global skala genom att möjliggöra världens dagliga vattenbehov. Du kommer också att tillhöra en respektfull och samarbetsvillig gemenskap som främjar karriärtillväxt och professionell utveckling. Du kommer att få stöd av resurser som gör en positiv skillnad i ditt liv eftersom vi på Hach värdesätter din äkthet och vill att dina talanger ska lysa.
   

  

**Are you…**
 Interested in working for an international and diverse company?
   

  

 Interested in a field-based role?
   

  

 Interested in working for a company that is dedicated to sustainability?
   

  

**If so, read on!**
 At Hach, we ensure water quality for people around the world. Protecting water, the most valuable resource, and driving sustainability are very close to our hearts. You will be part of a flexible, family-friendly organization that cares about its people just as it cares about the environment.
   

  

 We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
   

  

**We offer:**
* Flexible working hours
* Professional onboarding and training options
* Powerful team looking forward to working with you
* Career coaching and development opportunities


 The Sales Engineer is responsible for actively promoting the company’s solutions for municipal water applications, a part that drives significant impact on the organization. The water industry in Sweden is growing in the coming years and Hach needs talent who are enthusiastic about being part of our growth journey.
   

  

 This position is part of the Hach team in Sweden and will be working remotely preferably located within the Middle / Southern part of Sweden. At Hach, our vision is to provide valuable insights for experts in water and weather applications to help protect lives, the environment and infrastructure. You will be part of a culture working under the motto “Best team wins” where “Fun” and “Successful” go hand in hand. Hach is a global company with a tradition of recognizing and promoting ambitious people.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Perform all sales activities within assigned regions/customers to meet company objectives. Customer on-site visits are essential, virtual Teams meetings, trade shows, product demonstrations and customer seminars.
* Develop and execute sales action plans, identifying sales objectives, sales opportunities, and major customers.
* Prepare regular sales data such as forecasts and maintain customer activity files in the CRM system (Salesforce)
* Meet or exceed monthly or annual targets in assigned areas of responsibility.


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* A degree in Analytical Chemistry, Biology, Environment Sciences or Engineering. Alternate degrees or work experiences will be considered.
* Experience in solution selling in the Swedish market.
* Comfortable in representing solutions that are technical in nature, with experience gained in a technical environment.
* Must have a valid driving license and be willing and able to travel within the region.
* Strong influencing, negotiation, and communication skills in the Swedish language.


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* Knowledge and experience within the water industry.


 At Hach (
 **Hach Careers** 
 ), we ensure water quality for people around the world, and every associate plays a vital role in that mission. Our founding vision is to make water analysis better—faster, simpler, greener, and more informative. We accomplish this through teamwork, customer partnerships, passionate experts, and reliable, easy-to-use solutions.
   

  

 As part of our team, you’ll make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale by enabling the world’s everyday water needs. You’ll also belong to a respectful and collaborative community that fosters career growth and professional development. You’ll be supported by resources that make a positive difference in your life because, at Hach, we value your authenticity and want your talents to shine.
   

  

 At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
   

  

 If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

title: Internship Event Management
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for an Intern within Event Management to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We are looking for someone passionate about event planning and eager to gain hands-on experience. Our Brand & Marketing team seeks a motivated events Intern, to support our Head of Events in coordinating and executing various corporate events, webinars, and other initiatives to drive brand awareness and engagement.
   

  

* Assist with planning, coordination, and execution of digital, hybrid, and in-person events, including webinars, meetups, community nights, and conferences.
* Support in producing event marketing materials, such as registration sites, invitations, promotional emails, and social media.
* Provide on-site support during events, managing registration, attendee inquiries, and event setup/breakdown.
* Various administrative tasks.


 Your Potential Background
   

  

* Organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Professional written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment.
* Familiarity in Microsoft Office suite and event management tools is a plus.


**Benefits:**
* Gain hands-on experience in event planning within the growing tech industry.
* Expand your professional network.
* Flexible schedule and possibility for remote work arrangements.
* Opportunity for growth and potential for future employment opportunities.


**Duration:**
* The start and end dates are flexible.


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

 Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future
   

  

 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Operations Student Worker - Germany
description:
**Who We Are**
 Since our start in 2017 we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the world’s financial health.
   

  

 So far, we’ve helped Swedes, Finns, Norwegians and Germans save millions by refinancing expensive consumer credits. But we aim higher. New markets, new tools, new products and new ways of improving people’s financial lives. This means we need more brains and hearts to fuel our growth. That is why we are currently searching for an Operations Agent - Student Worker to our German team for all our three tracks: Care, Success and Risk.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Being an Operations Student Worker at Anyfin consists of three major areas:
   

  

* Analysing and evaluating more complicated customer applications to deliver suitable offers.
* Handling inbound communication with customers via email, phone, chat and social media.
* Handling outbound communication to increase our customer base.


 In addition, we offer three different development tracks in the Operations team. These are: Risk, Care and Success. We are truly passionate about being on the customers side and creating an outstanding customer experience. As a part of our tightly knit team you will impact the customer and the success of the company on a daily basis.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have excellent communication skills in German and English
* You are keen to learn and willing to take initiative
* You are self-motivated, fearless and have a great desire to contribute to the team and spread a positive atmosphere around you
* You are willing to work between 15-20 hours/week (with start as soon as possible)


**What We Offer**
 We offer you the chance to be part of something truly amazing. With strong backers and a world class team there is no limit to what we can achieve together. We were founded with a vision of challenging and transforming an industry that today is not taking into account the people it is supposed to serve.
   

  

 We are making a change. We have built a company of passionate doers with a curious urge to always do things better and smarter. We innovate, build and iterate. We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues.
   

  

 While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

**About Anyfin**
**Who are we?**
 Anyfin is an innovative startup with a mission to help people to become their best financial self. We know that money can be tricky for many, therefore we wanted to create an easier way of understanding and improving your finances.
   

  

**What do we do?**
 Anyfin is a smart financial-app where you get a great overview of your spendings, income, subscriptions and much more. We also provide a service that helps lowering the cost of consumer loans and credits by reducing high interests, and removing unnecessary fees. Overall, the app is a great tool to understand your finances better.
   

  

**What about the future?**
 We are constantly growing and by 2024 we will launch even more services. Fun, huh? Come join our journey and work with ambitious people from all over the world. (Our office is based in Stockholm.)
   

  

 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to track all of their credits and loans in one place and reduce the costs of high-interest credits.

title: Head of Platform Operations (DevOps Lead) - Stockholm
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight!**
**Normative is now looking for a Head of Engineering Enablement in Stockholm.**
***Please Note:** 
 Due to the summer vacation period, there will be a delay in the review of applications for this role. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time - we will come back to you as soon as we are able! We hope you have a wonderful Summer!*
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

 Our R&D team is now looking to hire an experienced Head of Platform Operations to lead our team responsible for Cloud/Infrastructure, Platform, Security and Quality. As a leader in our Engineering organisation, you will make a real impact on the fight against climate change and play a crucial role in helping companies achieve their NetZero goals and contribute to a sustainable future.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this pivotal role, you will drive the development and execution of strategies to optimise engineering operations, streamline processes, and ensure the delivery of high-quality software products. As a key leader within our R&D department, you will directly contribute to the success and growth of our business.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead and manage a team of approximately 7 employees across infrastructure, operations, quality and security.
* Develop and implement strategies to enhance engineering efficiency, productivity, and collaboration.
* Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of robust infrastructure ensuring our product is both highly available, resilient and secure.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimise engineering workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and increase operational resilience.
* Define and enforce best practices, standards, and processes for software development, testing, deployment, and security.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Engineering, Product Management, Design, and Compliance, to align engineering efforts with business objectives and product roadmap.
* Provide mentorship, coaching, and career development opportunities to team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth.


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience in a leadership role within a software engineering environment (preferably in a SaaS company).
* Strong technical background with expertise in SRE/Site Reliability Engineering, infrastructure, cloud computing (AWS, GCP), CI/CD pipelines, quality assurance practices, and security principles.
* Willingness to be hands-on along side the engineers in the team
* Demonstrated ability to effectively manage and motivate teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Ability to balance practical decision-making with innovation, ensuring technology choices align with the business's objectives.
* Strategic thinker with a track record of driving process improvements and operational excellence.


 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for DevOps culture, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
   

  

 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
   

  

**Location**
 Normative operates on a hybrid remote model with offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and London. For this role you will be located in our wonderful HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager


*Online Personality & Logic assessment*
* Interview with members of the Engineering team
* Practical Case Interview


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Azure DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa nya tjänster och automationer för våra kunder inom Cloud Transformation? Är du teknikdriven och vill arbeta i en mindre grupp med en tight gemenskap som ligger i framkant med relevant teknik? Då är du precis den vi söker!*
 Azure DevOps Engineer på Advania 🚀
   

  

 På Cloud Transformation, inom Advanias största affärsområde Managed Services Provider, hjälper vi våra kunder att etablera och utnyttja sin molnmiljö på bästa möjliga sätt.
   

  

 I rollen som DevOps Engineer hos oss arbetar du agilt med till exempel Azure DevOps och dess komponenter såsom pipelines, CI/CD för att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas i molnet. Du har också möjlighet att stötta i kundleveranser och jobba med arkitektur eller säkerhet vid intresse.
   

  

 Den geografiska placeringen spelar oss mindre roll. Jobba utifrån den placering som passar dig och din situation. Våra medarbetare finns bland annat på följande orter i Sverige: Stockholm, Göteborg, Norrköping, Örebro och Halmstad.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en rolig och utmanande roll i en innovativ miljö, där vår gruppering växer snabbt. Om du vill vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik och samtidigt ha kul på jobbet, så är detta din chans att ansluta till vårt team!
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och passa hos oss söker vi dig som är en teamplayer och självgående med öppenhet för att hjälpa andra. Vi tror att dina personliga egenskaper är avgörande för hur väl du kommer trivas hos oss, därför tror vi att du är nyfiken och teknikdriven, med tidigare erfarenhet av praktiskt arbete med Azure.
   

  

 Det skulle vara fantastiskt om du också har erfarenhet av att arbeta med automatisering och optimering av infrastruktur i Azure med verktyg som Bicep, PowerShell och Azure DevOps-pipelines.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du tidigare har erfarenhet av utveckling i språk eller tekniker såsom Python, Node.js, TypeScript, PowerShell, REST, YAML, Git men det är inget krav då vi har flera fantastiska medarbetare med den bakgrunden. Är du rätt person kan vi hjälpa dig utvecklas inom området Cloud Transformation.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering team in Stockholm. You will be responsible for the deployment of our Tbricks trading platform.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in the development of C++ financial markets software through the whole lifecycle from commit to deployment.
* Work in collaboration with development and QA teams to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
* Develop and maintain internal and client-facing Python tooling and services.
* Provide and receive technical feedback via well-established code-review practices.
* Promote and enforce best practices in our development teams.


**Profile Needed**
***Mandatory:***
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related STEM field.
* At least 5 years of experience in DevOps or C++ software engineering.
* Proficiency in Python
* Excellent Linux administration skills
* Experience with CI/CD systems (e.g. Bamboo, Jenkins)
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g. Ansible, Puppet, Terraform)
* Experience with containerization technologies (e.g. Docker Swarm, Kubernetes)
* Experience with monitoring technologies (e.g. Prometheus, OpenTelemetry)
* Great communication skills, with an ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams.


*Beneficial:*
* Experience with C++ build systems (e.g. CMake, Bazel), understanding of the compilation process and tooling ecosystem.
* Background in C++ development
* Experience with Ansible
* Experience with RPM specs and yum repositories


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work remote.
   

  

 Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.

title: DevSecOps
description:
Vi är på jakt efter dig som brinner för IT-säkerhet och ser molntekniken som en avgörande del av framtidens digitala lösningar.
   

  

**Dina spännande arbetsuppgifter:**
 Som DevSecOps -specialist hos oss blir du en viktig del av vårt team, där du kommer att arbeta med att säkerställa och skydda våra kunders IT-miljöer. Din roll innebär att hantera säkerhetsstrategier, implementera säkerhetslösningar och övervaka system för att förebygga och hantera säkerhetshot. Du kommer att få möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste säkerhetsteknikerna och bidra med din expertis i en mängd olika projekt.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Solida kunskaper och erfarenhet inom DevSecOps, särskilt med fokus på Microsofts produktportfölj.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med molntjänster som Azure eller AWS.
* Stark kompetens inom nätverks- och systemadministrationsverktyg.
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt på svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


 För att trivas i denna roll bör du vara analytisk, nyfiken och ha en problemlösande inställning. Du är självgående och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i team. Att vara proaktiv och hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknikerna inom IT-säkerhet är avgörande.
   

  

**Om B3** 
**Kodify** 
 :
   

  

 B3 Kodify är proffs på Cloud-teknologier som AWS, Azure och GCP samt metoder som DevOps/DevSecOps. Vi strävar efter att ligga i framkant när det kommer till moderna arbetssätt och vi älskar att krydda till det med moderna verktyg och tekniker som t.ex. Containers, moln, infrastruktur som kod osv. Vi är grymma på att hjälpa våra kunder att lyfta sina IT-koncept!
   

  

 Hos oss är måndagar lika uppskattade som fredagar! Vår hemlighet? Vi sätter stor vikt vid glädje, gemenskap och oförglömliga upplevelser - vare sig det är via en chatt på Slack eller genom våra gemensamma äventyr och afterworks. Och om det inte vore nog, erbjuder vi konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibilitet i vardagen och oändliga chanser för din personliga och professionella tillväxt. Gör varje dag till en anledning att fira med oss!
   

  

 Intresserad av att bli en del av B3 Kodify? Skicka din ansökan idag! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Jens på Jens.nilsson@b3.se
   

  

****Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!****
*B3 Kodify är en del av B3-koncernen och utnämndes till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work. Vi är också stolta över att vara Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022. Vi tror på våra värdeord: erfarenhet, mångfald och energi, och strävar efter hållbarhet i allt vi gör. Vi tror också att glada medarbetare presterar bättre och därför arrangerar vi regelbundna aktiviteter inom wellness, alltifrån yoga och simning till musikquiz, stickcafé och föreläsningar om stress och mental hälsa.*

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
Title: Senior Cloud Engineer
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 We are seeking a versatile Software Engineer to join our platform team, and work in a constantly evolving, dynamic, and agile environment, believing that the route to speed and stability is through automation. Teamwork, communication, and speaking your mind are of high importance to us, especially when they come with a curious mind, a willingness to grow, and exchange ideas and knowledge.
   

  

 In this role, along with a team of 8 members, you’ll set up AWS (Amazon Web Services) infrastructure which is handling millions of transactions worth billions of Euros. The team has a DevSecOps standpoint, owns, develops, and manages all Infrastructure as Code in AWS accounts, running 100s of containers and serverless functions; If you build it, you run it!
   

  

 If this looks exciting and you are eager to continue growing your professional capabilities with ongoing training and educational opportunities, come join us!
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
* Delivering the committed objectives that include adapting to any new needs to reach the goal
* On-call duty according to a rotating schedule
* Participate in your team's day-to-day activities including tools development, operations, maintenance, and support
* Being an active member in our agile events like daily stand-ups, planning, retros, and demos. etc.
* Foster team spirit, quality and technical agility


**Who Are We Looking For**
 We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
   

  

* You have proven experience in systems engineering, automating infrastructure creation & maintenance tasks using Docker, Jenkins, Terraform\ CloudFormation, etc.
* You have a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, distributed systems, software engineering, or another equivalent field
* You have previous experience in supporting/operating transaction driven and highly available platforms running microservices with 99.99% uptime
* You have a curiosity about security solutions such as WAF, IDS/IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
* You have work experience in programming (Python scripting) and an interest in automation
* You are passionate about cloud services, pay attention to details, handle many different partners and you are accountable to deliver results in a fast-paced environment


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Being a part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
* Health benefits contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead
description:
**About The Position**
 Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. We are on a journey of continuous growth – now looking for our next star – a driven and skilled Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead.
   

  

**As Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead at Dometic,** 
 you will be part of the new Data & AI Office and play an important role in supporting existing and coming initiatives within advanced analytics (predictive and generative AI solutions). AI and Advanced analytics initiatives are high on the agenda and will increase over the coming years – Dometic needs an architect to guide and accelerate the initiatives, that will mainly be driven from the business. The role is positioned at the HQ office in Solna Strand and you report to Head of Data & AI Office.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Keep track of advanced analytics solutions and initiatives within Dometic (portfolio management).
* Act as advanced analytics platform architect.
* Create guidelines and best practice around advanced analytics as well as establish and maintain an AI governance model.
* Guide, inspire and support the advanced analytics community within Dometic through leadership in Center of Excellence.
* Act in internal forums and advocate for solutions including advanced analytics.
* Participate in advanced analytics projects.
* Business stakeholder handling – throughout the whole organization.
* Act as early identifier of possible advanced analytics solutions.
* Contribute to prototyping of advanced analytics solution and give expert support for implementations.


**What do we offer?**
 You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow and take on new challenges. The growth at Dometic is continuous – which gives you great possibilities to evolve with the company.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be a** 
 proven track record of similar roles, you are a tech-savvy communicator and have an experience as for example Data Engineer or Data Scientist. You can guide business initiatives in best practices – as well as possessing the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* Bachelor or master’s degree in IT or another relevant field.
* Experience from developing advanced analytics solutions into operational solutions.
* Familiar with Azure services and how to configure platform and setup services for successful advanced analytics solutions.
* Experience from different cloud solutions and setups for advanced analytics platforms and services.
* Fluent in English and excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain solutions and technologies to business leaders, and requirements to colleagues in Analytics team and other stakeholders in the IT organization.


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* You are comfortable with guiding business representatives in their advanced analytics journey i.e., can understand business challenges and needs, translate that into solutions that meets the business expectations and bring value.
* You have the ability to operationalize developed and trained advanced analytics solutions into a production environment.
* You have the ability to see the whole picture, developing the whole chain from sourcing and cleaning relevant data into information model, prepared for analytical solution and apply applicable statistical models upon created data model.
* You have strong communication skills – and communicate comfortably at all levels in the organization.
* You are a structured, highly responsible and proactive person – who is confident and trustworthy.
* Finally, Dometic is a fast paced and dynamic company – this is an environment you know that you thrive in!


**And of course – our Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Karin Fryklund, Talent Acquisition Manager at karin.fryklund@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment, personality and logical test will be used as part of the process.

title: Project Control Engineer
description:
***Vill du vara med och jobba i Bravidas större och mer komplexa projekt? Får du energi av omväxling och snabbt tempo i en vänlig miljö? Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar att överträffa förväntningar genom din kunskap, ditt driv och intresse. Nu söker Bravida en driven och strukturerad Project Control Engineer till vårt ProjectManagementOffice där stora och komplexa projekt som Förbifart Stockholm och Nya tunnelbanan ingår. Är du redo för din nästa utmaning i din karriär?***
***Om jobbet***
 Som Project Control Engineer ansvarar du för att stödja och underlätta styrning, övervakning och rapportering av projektens framsteg, kostnader och tidsramar. Du assisterar vid utvecklingen och underhållet av projektplaner och tidscheman samt assisterar vid tilldelning och hantering av projektresurser. I tjänsten ansvarar du för att säkerställa att resurserna används effektivt och optimeras för att uppnå projektens mål. Du kommer att arbeta nära Project Control Lead och projektstyrningschefen för PMO.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av att:
   

  

* Förbereda och leverera regelbundna rapporter om projektets framsteg och prestanda till relevanta intressenter
* Stödja vid genomförandet av kvalitetskontroller och säkerställa att projektet följer fastställda kvalitetsstandarder och processer
* Kommunicera med projektteamet och andra berörda parter om projektens status


 Andra arbetsuppgifter än ovan förekommer i projekten, det krävs därav en flexibilitet i rollen
 **.** 
 Du kommer att utgå från Bravidas huvudkontor på Mikrofonvägen i Hägersten, men kommer även vara lokalt närvarande på våra projekt när det krävs, vilket innebär att vissa resor ingår i tjänsten. Rollen innebär inget ansvar över budget- och resultat eller personal.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är civilingenjör eller högskoleingenjör inom ingenjörsvetenskap, projektledning, ekonomi eller motsvarande utbildning. Du har minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från stora och komplexa projekt kopplat till projektstyrning och projektledning. Vidare ser vi att du är bevandrad med projektstyrningsverktyg samt metoder och har goda kunskaper i inom Microsoft Office. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift. Det är meriterande om du har kunskaper bland annat inom SharePoint Web Parts, Power Automate, Power BI, Primavera/Powerproject, hantering av Autodesk Construction Cloud och/eller VBA-programmering.
   

  

 Som person har du ett stort driv, engagemang och noggrannhet i ditt arbetssätt. Du är självgående och trivs att jobba efter ett tydligt strukturellt ramverk. Vidare ser vi gärna att du har en analytisk förmåga, är kommunikativ och har lätt för att skapa och bibehålla goda relationer med kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Bravida som arbetsgivare**
 Bravida är en stor arbetsgivare – faktiskt störst inom vår bransch i Norden. Det gör att vi kan erbjuda mycket till dig som medarbetare. I flera år i rad har vi blivit rankade till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare! Bravida eftersträvar mångfald och värdesätter en jämn könsfördelning. Vi arbetar som ett team och vi tycker om att skapa stora resultat, tillsammans.
   

  

 Förutom förmåner som exempelvis friskvårdsbidrag, hälsoundersökning och förmånliga försäkringar erbjuder Bravida dig ett självständigt och stimulerande arbete i en organisation där kompetens, utveckling och trivsel värderas högt. Vi på Bravida är vana att leverera högsta kvalitét till nöjda kunder och värnar om arbetsglädje likväl som en bra arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om Vårt erbjudande och hur du kan utvecklas hos oss.
 **När du växer, växer vi!**
**Hur söker jag jobbet?**
 Ansökningar hanteras löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum som är
 **2024-07-19** 
 . Du skickar in ditt CV och personliga brev genom att klicka på knappen Ansök nedan.
   

  

*Vi undanber oss kontakt med rekryteringsföretag i denna rekryteringsprocess*

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**About Tzeract:**
 Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.
   

  

 To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 We're seeking a seasoned
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 with expertise in Python, AWS, and microservices architecture, experienced in developing high-transaction systems. This role is vital for leading the design and development of our technology stack, ensuring our systems can handle the scale and speed required by our operations. You'll collaborate with a cross-functional team to build resilient, efficient, and secure solutions that support our data-driven decision-making processes.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and resilient microservices using Python and AWS technologies.
* Deep understanding and experience of Rust or Go is a plus.
* Lead initiatives to architect high-transaction systems capable of managing the volume and velocity of our data.
* Implement best practices in software engineering, including CI/CD, containerization, and automated testing to ensure quality and speed of deployments.
* Collaborate with data engineers and scientists to integrate AI models and algorithms into production systems efficiently.
* Mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.
* Stay ahead of the curve on new technologies, methodologies, and industry trends, applying them to improve our systems and processes.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years of software development experience, with a strong background in Python.
* Proven track record of developing and maintaining high-transaction, scalable systems.
* Extensive experience with AWS services and managing cloud-based infrastructure.
* Solid understanding of microservices architecture and container orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes).
* Experience with DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to lead projects and collaborate effectively across teams.
* Passion for sports and sports betting is a plus.


**Why Join Us:**
* Lead cutting-edge projects that are shaping the future of the sports betting industry.
* Work within a fast-paced, innovative environment that values your ideas and encourages growth.
* Competitive compensation package, including stock options, comprehensive health benefits, and flexible work arrangements.
* A culture that is passionate about technology, innovation, and sports.


**How to Apply:**
 Submit your resume, a brief cover letter outlining your experience with high-transaction systems and why you're interested in this role, and any relevant code samples or project links to us.
   

  

 We're excited to see how you can contribute to our team's success!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Key Account Manager - Public Sector
description:
**Join us in shaping a sustainable world free from plastic pollution**
 At PlasticFri our vision is a sustainable world free from plastic pollution. Plastics are made from petroleum and stay in the environment for thousands of years! By 2050, the oceans could have more plastic than fish. At PlasticFri, we are on a mission to change that.
   

  

 🏆 PlasticFri has been awarded as the “World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup” among 1400 companies Worldwide!
   

  

 🥇 We were also recently received the prestigious “Global Tech Innovator" award among 2000 technology companies worldwide.
   

  

 We are now scaling our team in order to continue our mission of creating a world free from plastic pollution, where circularity has been enabled.
   

  

**Key Account Manager Public Sector**
 As Key Account Manager (KAM) you have the responsibility for managing public sector relationships with the objective of maximizing business opportunities and revenue growth. This includes identifying, planning and executing activities that will generate upsales, cross sales and new product adoption. You will report to the Sales Manager.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Be To**
* Manage existing key customers and develop and nurture relationships, anticipate and understand their needs, challenges and objectives
* Create new business in the municipal and public sector, account plans with objectives, strategies and tactics to achieve sales targets
* Identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling, and new product adoption.
* Negotiate terms, contracts, and agreements, ensuring they align with both the client's needs and the company's objectives.
* Act as a primary point of contact for issue resolution, working closely with relevant teams to address client concerns promptly.
* Prepare regular reports on key account performance, revenue forecasts, and other relevant metrics
* Stay up to date with industry trends, adopt new technologies and foster a culture of innovation within the team to stay competitive
* Collaborate closely with other functions to ensure alignment and synergy between sales and the overall business strategy


**Ideal Candidate**
 In order to succeed in the role, we believe that you have:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of experience in sales within the public sector
* Experience of working with tenders (upphandlingar) in the municipal or public sector with a strong network
* Proven experience from managing the whole sales cycle with a strong sales toolkit: you can identify, segment, prospect, qualify, negotiate and close deals
* Good knowledge with the public procurement laws such as (offentlig upphandling, innovationsupphandling & förstudie)
* Excellent people skills, enjoying building and managing relationships with current and potential customers
* Excellent sales, presentation, negotiation and communication skills
* Great time management and organizational skills
* Fluent speaking and writing skills in both Swedish and English


**We Also See That You**
* Are very result-oriented with a determination to deliver on high goals
* Are passionate about impact and sustainability
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment, being a doer and learning on the way
* Are proactive and independent and take own initiatives and execute and deliver on them in order to achieve great results
* Possess self leadership, being accountable for your responsibilities and managing your work and time and development
* Have a willingness to travel for work if needed
* Have a network in the public and municipal sector

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 Kindred's ambition is to be the most insight driven gambling company and in the last few years we've invested heavily in our data and analytics capabilities. We are now at the next stage of our journey, building our capability for developing end-to-end machine learning data products, from research conducted by our Data Scientists through to production applications built by our Machine Learning Engineers.
   

  

 Our Machine Learning Engineers align with and work closely with Data Scientists in cross-functional product teams and are jointly responsible for the development of high-quality data products. We are currently focusing on areas including personalisation and relevancy, and product risk management. Additionally, we are building the core toolset and capability required for our product teams to scale efficiently and iterate rapidly. This includes our Model as a Service deployment platform, developing a feature store for use in both research and production contexts, and building the tooling we need to monitor and test our products.
   

  

**About You**
 We think that to be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate many of the following attributes:
   

  

* 3-5 years relevant commercial experience.
* Experience working alongside Data Scientists.
* A portfolio of deliveries of ML products.
* Experience deploying models as batch, streams, and as services.
* Excellent Java skills.
* Strong experience deploying containerised applications onto Kubernetes.
* Strong experience using Kafka (including Kafka Streams).
* Experience using Spark.
* Experience using Terraform.
* ML Operations (MLOps) tooling experience including AirFlow and MLFlow.
* Experience in AWS cloud computing.
* Passionate about your personal development.
* Excellent interpersonal skills: able to collaborate, explain complex topics and contribute to the success of cross-functional DS/MLE product teams.
* Ability to deal with and account for uncertainty, with the flexibility to learn by iteration. Proactive.


**In addition, it would be an advantage if you also have:**
* A knowledge of enterprise data concepts, including Data Mesh.
* Solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning methodologies.
* AWS certification.
* An interest in mentoring and coaching more junior team member

title: Technical Project Manager (Cloud & Connectivity) – Stockholm
description:
Vi söker nu en teknisk projektledare till vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team, där du har chansen att arbeta med de senaste teknikerna i projekt med fokus på molnbaserad integration. Hos oss är flexibilitet, teamarbete, kompetensutveckling och projektrotationer centrala inslag – kanske är det just dig vi söker som vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 Hos oss har du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. Vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team ansvarar för att designa, utveckla och implementera integrationslösningar i molnmiljöer. Vi har en cloud-first strategi sedan flera år tillbaka och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden när det gäller offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – i samarbete med viktiga aktörer som Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

**Som Technical Project Manager Hos Oss Kommer Du**
* Planera och leda arbete kopplat till en eller flera kundleveranser
* Planera och hantera de resurser som krävs för att möta projektets behov
* Samordna tekniska team, förstå komplexa tekniska krav och fatta beslut som påverkar tekniska lösningar.
* Fungera som en kommunikationsbrygga mellan tekniska team och andra intressenter.
* Hantera och minimera tekniska risker och utmaningar som kan uppstå under projektets gång.
* Samarbeta med kollegor i en miljö som präglas av hög grad av eget ansvar och tillit.


 Vi jobbar främst med molnbaserade plattformar eller ramverk i molntekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS. Några av de tekniker som ofta används i våra projekt inkluderar bl.a. Boomi, Azure Logic Apps, Azure API Management, Software AG (webMethods). Storleken på projekt kan variera men de är vanligtvis relativt småskaliga från 3-10 personer.
   

  

**För Att Lyckas i Rollen Har Du**
* Erfarenhet inom teknisk projektledning eller service delivery i IT-projekt gentemot kunder
* Bra förståelse för utveckling och leverans av tekniska lösningar från krav till färdig lösning
* Erfarenhet från hela utvecklingsflödet och gärna arbetat med någon strukturerad utvecklingsmodell/process
* God erfarenhet av att jobba agilt


 Vi ser även att du har erfarenhet av att delta i eller leda:
   

  

* Kravinsamling och kravanalys
* Lösningsdesign
* Utveckling
* Test i olika nivåer (enhet, integration, acceptanstester)
* Samordning med användare och andra intressenter


 Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm eller Göteborg. Vi erbjuder både möjlighet att arbeta på plats och på distans med flexibla arbetsmodeller – resor till kund kan ibland förekomma.
   

  

 Hur definieras rollen som Project Lead på Solita? Läs mer i vårt globala Project Lead Manifesto.
   

  

**Karriärbanor på Solita**
 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi värdesätter individanpassning och ser på karriärvägar som inte enbart en stege utan snarare som ett landskap med flera möjliga riktningar, både vertikalt och horisontellt, inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

**Vem är vi?**
 Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med expertis inom data, design, moln, integrationer och mjukvaruutveckling. Med över 2000 medarbetare (varav 200 i Sverige) är vi tillräckligt stora för att våga ta ut svängarna och tillräckligt små för att bry oss om varandra och våra kunder. Genom att värna om kontinuerligt lärande ser vi till att vi har intressanta projekt för framtiden, och även möjligheter till projektrotationer.
   

  

**Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;**
* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i branscher, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* Growth Academy – vår kunskapsportal för att stödja din utveckling och dina ambitioner. Vi har en lärande kultur och uppmuntrar våra medarbetare att växa och bredda sina kunskaper genom en rad kompetensnätverk, info sessions, föreläsningar och certifieringar;
* En trygg och human arbetsmiljö för att främja innovation, motivation och välmående;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, Friday breakfasts, AWs, bike leasing, intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer om Solita på* 
*Glassdoor* 
 !
   

  

**Låter det spännande?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering; vi går igenom ansökningar och kontaktar löpande de kandidater som bäst matchar vår kravprofil för denna roll.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

**Vi rekryterar också till vårt kontor i** 
**Göteborg** 
**!**

title: Enterprise Business Development Representative, Nordics
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
   

  

*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
**About The Job**
 It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
   

  

*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
**Company Overview**
 At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to
   

  

* Build and enhance our proven security platform.
* Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture
* Analyse new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel
* Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges


 We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are currently seeking a highly motivated and energetic individual to join our Business Development team to generate qualified sales opportunities for our Enterprise Nordic Sale team. As part of the Business Development team, you will be working closely with the regional sales and marketing teams to generate sales accepted leads via multiple channels with a mix of inbound (lead follow-up) and outbound (prospecting) activities.
   

  

 As a Business Development Representative, you will be responsible for gathering intelligence and developing a deep understanding of your assigned accounts. You will then action this intelligence to connect our sales team with influencers and decision makers within the prospect accounts and across all vertical markets.
   

  

 You will work closely with both Account Management and Marketing to define and execute a successful account-based sales strategy for the Nordic region
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Qualify and develop inbound and outbound sales accepted leads and respond to product inquiries
* Gather actionable intelligence (competition, projects, purchase intent, etc.) for the list of accounts that you will be responsible for
* Follow-up on all leads generated by marketing and convert initial interest into sales accepted leads
* Manage email campaigns to generate new sales prospects
* Manage cold-calling telephone-based campaigns to generate new sales prospects
* Complete accurate tracking of communication with current and potential customers in Salesforce.com
* Schedule demonstrations between Enterprise Sales team members and potential customer


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Highly motivated individual with a competitive personality, and good attention to detail
* Previous experience with solutions that can be deployed in private or public clouds a plus
* Experience working with Salesforce.com or other CRM is a bonus
* Excellent phone and interpersonal communication skills (verbal and written) as well as organisational skills
* Previous experience working and succeeding in a goal-driven environment preferred
* Academic qualifications Degree level educated ideally
* Fluent English & Swedish language skills required. Any additional languages are a plus


**Why Proofpoint**
 As a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!
   

  

*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!*
*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!*

title: Tech Sales Representative Cloud Marketplace platform - Norwegian Speaking
description:
Join Pax8, a
 **Cloud** 
**Technology Unicorn** 
 that is growing exponentially across Europe. Contribute as a
 **Tech Sales Representative** 
 to the unstoppable momentum of Pax8 EMEA by identifying and nurturing new business opportunities, making connections that matter.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Norwegian speaking** 
 individual who is great at building relationships and connecting with people by phone to
 **join our Pax8 rocket ship in Sweden** 
 .
   

  

**It's our mission** 
 to be the
 **world’s favourite marketplace** 
 to buy
 **cloud products** 
 .
   

  

 Our servant leaders put employees first and we are about delivering exceptional employee experience to inspire customer experience.
   

  

 We are Pax8 where our employee experience meets customer experience - come and be "work happy" with us!
   

  

 It's an exciting time to join us as Pax8 EMEA enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth!
   

  

 Get a feel for our progress, culture and how we constantly strive to be better and do better below:
   

  

 Taste our values & culture here:
   

  

 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/careers/
   

  

 Check our HR Leaders people ethos here:
   

  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-IO3JTx-Dlo
   

  

 See our progress in Awards:
   

  

 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/news-post/pax8-triumphs-with-three-awards-at-the-comptia-uki-spotlight-awards/
   

  

 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/news-post/pax8-named-50th-best-mid-sized-company-to-work-for-in-the-uk/
   

  

 John Street CEO of the year 2023
   

  

 Find new and updated links and articles from our
 **Blog** 
 and
 **News** 
 pages.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
 You will be working in a mature Cloud market. We help our partners build revenue and succeed with cloud services.
 **As a Tech Sales Representative** 
**you will introduce our Pax8 Cloud Marketplace Platform with hundreds of cloud products from the industry’s leading vendors to Small Technology Service Providers to enhance their growth, reduce risk and improve efficiencies.**
 There is
 **no shortage of leads** 
 to generate conversations you could have with more than 149,000 different businesses that could access our platform and use the services we provide to grow their technology business.
   

  

**﻿**
**Your day to day role includes:**
* Increase brand awareness and introduce Pax8’s Cloud services via telephone, email and social media to identify new business
* Provide a high-level overview of Pax8 products and services to potential new Channel Partners to the Pax8 program
* Book follow on discussions with Specialist Account Managers on products related to Productivity, Security, Infrastructure and Continuity products from best in class players like Microsoft, AWS, Acronis, Ironscales, Autotask, Adobe
* Utilise Salesforce to develop and manage a consistent pipeline of qualified prospective opportunities


**You’ll be the ideal Cloud Sales Representative for us if you:**
* Are fluent in Norwegian with good Swedish and English language skills, written and spoken
* Are keen to grow your career in Sales, are a fast learner with drive and a passion for technology
* Enjoy connecting and engaging with people by email and telephone with excellent communication skills
* Are proficient with social media (LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook)
* Have a strong ability to work independently while supporting a team
* Have the energy and drive to achieve volume phone calls daily
* Can maintain high motivation and a great attitude
* Are coachable and willing to learn


 Culturally you’ll be comfortable in, and perhaps come from, a complex, fast growing technology business.
   

  

**Pax8 Stockholm Office Environment**
* Energetic WeWork Office soon to be revamped
* Regular social and community events
* Naturally light offices for wellbeing at work
* Dedicated desks and breakout arrears with laptop dock and monitors
* Starting salary of 27,000 SEK monthly gross with on-target earnings of up to 34,500 SEK


 In order to fulfil this role you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.
   

  

**﻿We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where there are a diversity of perspectives.**
 We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - Our Talent team are based in the UK - Please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!
   

  

 If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring Victoria Werder the talent partner managing this role on +44 117 457 7913 Recruiter DDI (No Agencies Please)
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
 Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are g
 **rowth minded and curious** 
 , there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 37%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & Linkedin Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level. You might even get to exchange work location one day with your colleagues in the USA, APAC or across Europe but even if you can't travel right now we guarantee you'll still have fun!
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
**﻿**
**Pax8 is the world’s favourite cloud marketplace for IT professionals to buy, sell and manage best-in-class technology solutions.** 
 The global Pax8 Marketplace features 30,000+ resellers (Managed Service Providers), 400,000+ Small to Medium Businesses (SMBs) and 10+ million end users. We are scaling globally (in a responsible way) while remaining dynamic. As a high-energy organisation, it means everyone can make a meaningful impact in the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it’s business, and it IS personal. We are passionate, creative, and unconventional. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best!
   

  

 We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the country applied for. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.
   

  

 Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/job-applicant-privacy-notice/)

title: AUTOMATION ENGINEER
description:
**FÖRETAG**


Stena Recycling Group

**PLATS**


Göteborg, Sverige

**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM**


2024-08-24

**YRKESOMRÅDE**


Ingenjör



  
*The R&D Department provides a support function for the whole Stena Metall Group. We conduct a range of projects and activities, within five focus areas, identified and decided upon by companies within the Group. We prioritize value-creating solutions that support the business and secure state of art technology. Our responsibilities include project management and cross functional work in our focus areas, providing expertise in future recycling technology, contributing technical skills and support in our areas of expertise.*

  


**Are you curious and driven by delivering quality results? Do you want to help take our recycling business further and contribute to a better tomorrow in terms of sustainability? Then this can be the role for you!**

  



Stena Recycling Group is expanding the team of skilled engineers within Research and Development to meet the various initiatives run in our focus areas. You will report to Process and Technology Manager and will be placed in Gothenburg or Halmstad.


**Our offer**



At Stena, you get a safe and fun workplace, full of competent and helpful colleagues who are happy to share their knowledge. We care about health, well-being and life balance. When you become a part of Stena Recycling Group we offer you benefits like:


* A challenging and exciting position where you get the opportunity to both develop and be developed
* Opportunity to develop in areas like material knowledge, leadership, digital tools and other things of interest
* Work in a stable organization where we want to develop our employees and leaders in the long term
* A variety of benefits from our portal Benify but also collective agreements, insurance, wellness allowance, etc.


**Your focus on operation technology within industry 4.0**



As an Automation engineer in our R&D department, you will be part of a team of currently 35 people and be involved in driving process engineering solutions in projects of varying size and complexity. You will be the technology owner in projects working with early project phases, design and implementation of both small and large development projects within our facilities.



You will work with everything related to any area of Industi 4.0. Such as technology development, design, procurement and commissioning.



You will also have a role where you expertice will be used to train and develop our team as the department grows.



Your time will be divided between work from our office, working from home and at our facilities both in Sweden and Europe.


**It starts with you**!



You are an experienced engineer with a broad background in the process or production industry and many years of experience working in projects and development and streamlining of production. To succeed in the role, you have a technical interest, solid knowledge and are curious. As a person, you are communicative, responsive, relationship-building and take your place in a humble way both on our facilities as internally in the office.



You need to be a flexible person who thrives in a changing environment and wants to be involved in developing the internal work in the R&D department as well as at our facilities.



It is preferred if you have experience from programming and deploying OT-systems such as PLC and SCADA. It is a bonus if you have worked with kepserver implementations or other object-oriented programming software.



You will be working in cross-functional and international teams including external stakeholders. Therefore, spoken and written Swedish and English on professional level is necessary.



If you have previous experience linked to Recycling industry and Automation this is a merit.



Driver license is a requirement.
  
**ANSÖKAN**
-----------


Hope we have caught your attention. Join our ride today and help us, by using your potential, to make a difference and form a sustainable tomorrow! We look forward to your application as soon as possible, selection will be running continuously. We do background check in the recrutmentprocess  

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:**  

2024-08-24
**DATASKYDDSDEKLARATION**
-------------------------


Stena Metall AB har åtagit sig att skydda och respektera din integritet. Vi vill att du ska känna dig trygg när vi behandlar dina personuppgifter. För att säkerställa en hög skyddsnivå för de personuppgifter du delar med oss kommer vi inte att behandla de ansökningar som skickas till oss via e-post. Skicka in din ansökan enligt instruktionerna.

title: Full-stack / Back-end engineer
description:
**Who We Are**
 Visendi is a cutting-edge AI lab based in Stockholm, Sweden, dedicated to pioneering the integration of generative AI into product development, e-mobility/sustainable energy, and manufacturing. Our mission is to bridge the gap between traditional industries and generative AI technologies, enabling transformative innovation and efficiency.
   

  

**Our Approach**
 At Visendi, we specialize in tailoring, customizing, and orchestrating generative AI models to build AI-powered applications that meet the unique needs of our industry partners. Through deep collaboration and research, we help companies set digital strategies and develop custom AI solutions that drive sustainable growth. Our team seamlessly integrates AI into client operations, ensuring impactful and lasting results. Employees may work exclusively on customer projects, in our AI lab, or enjoy a mix of both, providing a diverse and dynamic work environment that bridges theory and practice.
   

  

**The Role**
* Develop and maintain a full-stack web application powered by generative AI for clients in the e-mobility/sustainable energy sector.
* Focus on back-end development using mainly C# while also contributing to front-end tasks as needed.
* Collaborate closely with AI engineers to integrate generative AI models into the application, enhancing functionality and user experience.
* Participate in iterative development cycles, adapting quickly to feedback and evolving project requirements.


 This position is fully allocated towards customer projects and requires working on-site in central Stockholm, ensuring seamless communication and alignment with their needs and goals.
   

  

**We Seek a Self-Starter Who Is**
* Proficient in full-stack development with a strong emphasis on back-end programming in C# and Python.
* Experienced in working cloud-based environments (Eg., Azure).
* Comfortable working with container services such as Docker.
* Capable of handling diverse tasks in a fast-paced, iterative startup setting.
* Has a keen interest in generative AI technologies.


**Your Profile**
* Comfortable working in fast-moving startup environments and adapting to rapidly changing requirements.
* Previous exposure to AI technologies, particularly generative AI, is beneficial.


 While formal education is appreciated, we place a higher value on real-world experience and the hands-on building of various applications. Your proven ability to develop and implement effective solutions is what truly matters to us.
   

  

**Why Join Visendi?**
* Be part of a pioneering AI lab driving innovation in traditional industries.
* Collaborate with a dynamic team of experts in AI and industry-specific fields.
* Work on diverse projects, from AI research to hands-on client implementations.
* Enjoy a flexible work environment that values creativity and professional growth.
* Benefit from opportunities to work on-site with leading companies and make a tangible impact.
* Contribute to sustainable and forward-thinking projects in e-mobility and energy.


**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 recruitment@visendi.ai

title: Senior Sales Engineer, Sweden
description:
**Life at UiPath**
 The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.
   

  

 To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.
   

  

 Could that be you?
   

  

**Your Mission**
 The Senior Sales Engineer will focus on partnering with the Account Executive to generate revenue with technical ownership of the opportunity pursuits throughout the sales cycle.
   

  

 You, as a Senior Sales Engineer, must possess a winning combination of business and technical skills, with the ability to present and demonstrate our solutions to a broad spectrum of audiences while building strong relationships throughout the entire sales cycle.
   

  

 This role is based in Sweden and will eventually require some travel.
   

  

**What You'll Do At UiPath**
* Deliver on UiPath’s value propositions in a persuasive and executive manner
* Demonstrate ability to transform strategic business challenges to UiPath capabilities
* Articulate high level solutions to fit client needs and environment during a deal process
* Learn the benefits of new and exciting technologies and how to integrate with UiPath
* Drive end-user adoption of UiPath products through events, seminars, webinars, technical training, and other activities as appropriate
* Work closely with the Customer Success and Professional Services teams to make solutions a reality for the customer
* Support Marketing initiatives through evangelism activities, including writing blogs, speaking in
* UiPath webinars and other industry events
* Contribute to clients’ business objectives by offering an industry-relevant perspective on markets and industries
* Lead technical engagements across the sales process


**What You'll Bring To The Team**
* Ability to work in harmony with the UiPath values; Humble, Bold, Immersed, and Fast
* Good balance of sales, business, and technical skills
* Ability to build and maintain customer relationships that will be significantly leveraged in driving additional business
* Ability to influence client technology decisions with a UiPath solution
* Ability to validate proposed solutions and architectures, and create appropriate messaging for sales and technical staff
* Fluent written and spoken English and Swedish. Other Nordic languages is an advantage.
* Excellent presentation skills
* Previous experience working with UiPath, or another RPA platforms is desirable


 Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above— but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.
   

  

 Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.
   

  

 We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.
